definition: to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])

sentences.english: Pigs are born to give, to yield and to serve.
sentences.chinese: 属猪者天生乐于付出，谦让，为他人效劳。

sentences.english: The virtue of comity is Chinese nation's fine tradition.
sentences.chinese: 反对争利，倡导谦让，这是中华民族的优良传统。

sentences.english: Faced with complex and ever-changing society, do you shake off their own humility.
sentences.chinese: 面对复杂多变的社会，你是否动摇过自己的谦让之心。

sentences.english: Humility, justice and kindness are virtues.
sentences.chinese: 谦让，公正和善良是美德。

sentences.english: The first time was on her humility can be a time when they rise.
sentences.chinese: 第一次是在她可以上升而却谦让的时候。

sentences.english: Knowledge makes humble, ignorance makes proud.
sentences.chinese: 学问使谦让，无知使高慢。

sentences.english: Vehicles encountered intersection, the U. S. drivers are polite humility, and never steal Road.
sentences.chinese: 遇到车辆交会，美国司机往往礼貌谦让，决不抢道。

sentences.english: Let yourself be encouraged. Don’t be self-effacing or overly modest.
Without any modesty, Chu Jen Wang sat down in the seat of honour.
sentences.chinese: 王举人也不谦让，一屁股在上首坐了。

sentences.english: Purpose is to let people learn content and not too selfish .
sentences.chinese: 其他答案内容主旨是让人学会谦让，不能太自私。

sentences.english: Don't invite all meritorious, leave three points with people, leave some room with humility oneself.
sentences.chinese: 有功不必邀尽，留三分余地与人，留些谦让与己。

sentences.english: Appreciate the concern and care for humility.

definition: to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to yield to one another/mutual accommodation
respect the old and cherish the young
to show consideration for (others)/to yield to (another vehicle etc)/courtesy/comity
